events.event_name: January 2026 HCOB Italy Construction PMI Release
events.description: The release of the Purchasing Managers' Index for the Italian construction sector in January 2026.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Italy Construction PMI fell to 47.7 in January 2026 from 47.9 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Italy Construction PMI edged down to 47.7 in January 2026 from 47.9 in December

facts.fact_text: Employment growth in the Italian construction sector reached a seven-month high in January.

evidences.evidence_text: employment growth accelerated to a seven-month high as companies favored permanent staff

facts.fact_text: Civil engineering was the only sub-sector to show growth in January.

evidences.evidence_text: civil engineering was the only area to record a small uptick

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty regarding the economic outlook dampened demand for new construction projects.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: Order books fell at one of the steepest rates in over a year as uncertainty dampened demand

claims.claim_text: Business confidence remains positive due to expectations of future projects.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: Business confidence weakened but remained marginally positive, with firms citing expected future projects

claims.claim_text: The PNRR deadline is creating uncertainty that negatively impacts business sentiment.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: uncertainty around the PNRR deadline tempered sentiment

evidence.evidence_text: Housing remained the weakest segment, posting a substantial drop and weighing most on the headline index
Input cost inflation picked up due to higher raw material and energy prices
uncertainty around the PNRR deadline tempered sentiment
Order books fell at one of the steepest rates in over a year as uncertainty dampened demand
